statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: You are given a tree, it��s root is p, and the node is numbered from 1 to n. Now define f(i) as the number of nodes whose number is less than i in all the succeeding nodes of node i. Now we need to calculate f(i) for any possible i.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
Multiple cases (no more than 10), for each case:
The first line contains two integers n (0<n<=10^5) and p, representing this tree has n nodes, its root is p.
Following n-1 lines, each line has two integers, representing an edge in this tree.
The input terminates with two zeros.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output n integer in one line representing f(1), f(2) �� f(n), separated by a space.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: 2011 Multi-University Training Contest 5 - Host by BNU
